     return torch._C._cuda_getCurrentBlasHandle()
 
 
+def empty_cache():
+    """Frees all unused memory currently held by the cache allocator"""
body:
I'm not sure how to phrase this, but maybe it's worth pointing out that not all of your free memory will be released. For example, if you:
1) allocate 10 GB
2) free 10 GB
3) allocate 2 MB
4) empty_cache()

You'll still have ~9.998 GB showing up as used in nvidia-smi because the 10GB segment is occupied by the 2 MB in-use allocation.
